alert.note: Alert for Allen; Butler; Cowley; Elk; Greenwood; Harper; Kingman; Neosho; Sedgwick; Sumner; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 22 at 8:56AM CST until December 22 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Wichita
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wichita has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Elk County in southeastern Kansas... Wilson County in southeastern Kansas... Cowley County in south central Kansas... Neosho County in southeastern Kansas... Sedgwick County in south central Kansas... Butler County in south central Kansas... Harper County in south central Kansas... Southern Kingman County in south central Kansas... Sumner County in south central Kansas... Woodson County in southeastern Kansas... Greenwood County in southeastern Kansas... Allen County in southeastern Kansas... * Until 1000 AM CST. * At 853 AM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 5 miles north of Attica to near Belle Plaine to 7 miles northeast of Severy to 7 miles south of Bronson, moving southeast at 30 mph. * This snow squall will continue moving southeast into far southern Kansas through 10 to 11 AM. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Near whiteout conditions at times. Wind gusts greater than 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar, ground-truth observations, and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 0 and 20. Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 1 and 82. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Derby, El Dorado, Arkansas City, Winfield, Andover, Haysville, Augusta, Chanute, Wellington, Park City, Valley Center, Bel Aire, Mulvane, Iola, Goddard, Rose Hill, Maize, Eureka and Neodesha. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.

area.areaDesc: Allen; Butler; Cowley; Elk; Greenwood; Harper; Kingman; Neosho; Sedgwick; Sumner; Wilson; Woodson
